title: Putin Nods to Xi’s ‘Concerns,’ and the Limits of Their Cooperation
description: The discordant messages of China’s president, Xi Jinping, and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia suggested that despite an earlier pledge of “friendship,” Moscow does not have an unconditional ally in Beijing.

title: In ‘Cancer Alley,’ Judge Blocks Huge Petrochemical Plant
description: The company, an affiliate of Formosa Plastics, said it intended to move forward with the $9.4 billion complex in St. James Parish despite the ruling.

title: Pope Francis: Arming Ukraine Can Be ‘Morally Acceptable'
description: The pontiff said that it is acceptable for countries to provide weapons to Ukraine so that the country can defend itself, but stressed that communication channels with Russia should remain open.

title: Princess Anne’s Influence, and Workload, Rises in a Slimmed-Down Royal Family
description: Often appearing at more than 400 events a year, Anne is likely to become even more central as a trusted adviser to her brother, the king.

title: Biden to Meet With Families of Griner and Whelan, Who Are Imprisoned in Russia
description: The fates of both Americans have been complicated by the deteriorating diplomatic relationship between the United States and Russia over President Vladimir V. Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Your Friday Briefing: The Putin-Xi Summit
description: Plus Europe’s tilt to the right continues, and Roger Federer is retiring.

title: What is Putin hoping for from Xi?
Rise of Far-Right Party in Sweden Was Both Expected and Shocking
description: The Sweden Democrats, with roots in neo-Nazism, came in second in national elections and will have a powerful influence on a new center-right government.

title: A Detailed Rundown of Queen Elizabeth’s Funeral Day
description: On Monday, dignitaries from across the globe will bid farewell to the queen at a service in Westminster Abbey.

title: Mexico Arrests Army General Linked to Disappearance of 43 Students
description: A top military officer suspected of ordering the killing of at least six of the students who disappeared in 2014 has been arrested, the latest in a string of high-profile arrests.

title: European Union Signals a Move Away from Wood Energy
description: Wood was supposed to help the E.U. reach its renewable energy goals. But it has contributed to increased emissions and a loss of Europe’s protected woodlands.

title: Attempt to Kill Argentina’s Vice President Fuels Conspiracy Theories
description: An assassination attempt against Argentina’s vice president, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, failed. Now many Argentines believe the entire event was a hoax.

title: U.K. Health Ministry Wants No Oxford Commas. Period.
description: The directive discourages the use of the contentious grammatical device, and also encourages employees to be “positive” and to avoid “jargon.”

title: Mexico Arrests Army General Linked to Disappearance of 43 Students
description: A top military officer suspected of ordering the killing of at least six of the students who disappeared in 2014 has been arrested, the latest in a string of high-profile arrests.

title: Marvel Attracts Criticism With Israeli “Captain America” Superhero
description: The studio has angered many Palestinians and their supporters by casting the actress Shira Haas to play Sabra, a mutant Mossad agent, in a “Captain America” movie.

title: Germany offers one of the largest Holocaust reparations packages, and a special fund for Ukrainians
description: The country will pay $1.2 billion, including emergency aid for Holocaust survivors in Ukraine and, for the first time, remembrance education.

title: Britain Has a New King. The Swans Have a New Owner.
description: Thanks to a centuries-old law, the country’s monarch also happens to be the owner of its population of mute swans.

title: Russia Damages a Dam in Ukraine, Sparking Flooding Fears
description: The attack sent millions of gallons of water gushing downstream and officials said a catastrophe had been narrowly avoided.

title: Germany Offers Special Fund for Ukrainian Holocaust Survivors
description: The $12 million emergency fund, part of a larger $1.2 billion reparations package, will be disbursed to 8,500 Jewish survivors in Ukraine.

title: Putin’s Meeting With Xi Is Intended to Display Russia-China Ties
description: The authoritarian leaders are set to meet in Uzbekistan. In the Ukrainian city of Kryvyi Rih, Russian missiles damaged a dam.

title: The Fog of San Francisco
description: It’s a life force, with an uncertain future.

title: Thousands Join ‘The Queue’ to See Queen Elizabeth Lying in State
description: Thousands of people waited in line — a very long line — to pay homage at the coffin of Queen Elizabeth II, who will lie in state until her funeral on Monday.

title: Zelensky Is Involved in a Car Accident but Isn’t Seriously Hurt
description: Ukraine’s president did not mention the accident during his nightly address.

title: Fearing flooding, Ukrainian officials call for evacuations after Russia damaged a dam.
description: Pedestrian bridges were washed away and water rose along river banks in the city of Kryvyi Rih in southern Ukraine, where Kyiv’s forces are carrying out a counteroffensive.

title: Who’s Attending Queen Elizabeth’s Funeral, and Who Isn’t
description: President Biden plans to be there, as do many leaders from the Commonwealth.

title: Solar Energy Is Helping Schools Make Ends Meet
description: Public schools are increasingly using savings from solar energy to upgrade facilities, help their communities, and give teachers raises — often with no cost to taxpayers.

title: 5 Russian Bullets Dashed an Opera Singer’s Dreams. Then He Reclaimed His Voice.
description: While on a rescue mission in Ukraine, Sergiy Ivanchuk was shot in the lungs, apparently ending his chance at opera stardom. His recovery is a marvel of medicine, chance and his own spirit.

title: Giorgia Meloni May Lead Italy, and Europe Is Worried
description: The hard-right leader has excoriated the European Union in the past, and she regularly blasts illegal immigrants and George Soros. But she is closer than ever to becoming prime minister.

title: Woman Is Arrested in South Korea Over Deaths of 2 Children in New Zealand
description: The children’s bodies were found in suitcases that had been in a storage facility, said the New Zealand police, who are seeking the woman’s extradition on murder charges.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Zelensky at the front.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Zelensky at the front.

title: Putin to Meet With Xi, China’s Leader, as Their Ties Strengthen
description: The two authoritarian leaders are facing increasing animosity with the West and challenges to their agendas.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Zelensky at the front.
